description: Centre-back Ben Cabango has signed a new contract to remain with Swansea City.
title: Swansea City: Wales defender Ben Cabango signs new Swans deal
title_page: Swansea City: Wales defender Ben Cabango signs new Swans deal - BBC Sport
maintext:
Defender Ben Cabango has signed a new contract to remain with Swansea City until the summer of 2028.
The centre-back's previous deal with the Swans was due to expire at the end of the current season.
"I'm really happy to have signed a new contract with Swansea City," said the 24-year-old.
"We've been talking about it for a while and I think since Andy's [chairman Andy Coleman] taken over it's been really positive.
"I've seen the change obviously with the gaffer as well. It's all been more positive and everything is going in the right direction."
Luke Williams is a huge admirer of the Cardiff-born defender and was among those involved - along with Coleman and captain Matt Grimes - in delivering a presentation to Cabango to help convince him to sign a new deal.
Cabango - who scored in a 1-1 draw with Bristol City in September - has been a key figure under Williams having played every single minute of Championship action so far this season.
